intro: Myxopyrum enerve, commonly known as the slender false lily of the wall, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to greenish flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Myxopyrum enerve is often found in dry, calcareous soils and is considered a characteristic species of rocky or gravelly habitats.
